meanings.definition: To inspect or check something before use or operation.
meanings.sent1: She always preflights her car before a long road trip.
meanings.sent2: The pilot preflights the aircraft before takeoff to ensure everything is in order.
meanings.sent3: Before the big race, the athlete preflights his running shoes to make sure they are ready to go.
meanings.sent4: The chef preflights the ingredients before starting to cook, just like a pilot checks the plane before flying.
meanings.sent5: Preflighting your homework before submitting it can help you catch any mistakes.

meanings.definition: The act of inspecting or checking something before use or operation.
meanings.sent1: The preflight of the equipment revealed a small issue that needed to be fixed.
meanings.sent2: A thorough preflight is essential before launching a rocket into space.
meanings.sent3: The preflight of the new product design showed that it was not ready for production yet.
meanings.sent4: The preflight of the safety procedures ensured that all measures were in place to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent5: The preflight of the emergency plan helped the team respond quickly to the unexpected situation.
